title: CHiPs
synopsis: Space Ghost welcomes two talk-show experts, Bill Carter and Joe Franklin. Carter, author of "The Late Shift," explains why Space Ghost was excluded from the book. Franklin, the world's first TV talk show host, gives him a few pointers. Moltar introduces his fascination with the television series "CHiPs," a theme that will resurface again and again.

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (watching opening on control room monitor; laughs, throws lever. Space Ghost invisos in on set)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hi, I am Space Ghost. Welcome to the show. (waves) (subtitle: SPACE GHOST PONCHERELLO)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (playing keyboard) (subtitle: ZORAK PONCHERELLO)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (mumbling) yeah, Space Ghost... (throws lever, monitor switches to "CHiPs") Cool... "CHiPs".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Joining me tonight... author Bill Carter, originator of the talk show, Joe Franklin, AND, talk show legend, Johnny Carson! Please say hello to the band, Zorak and the... (looks over at Zorak, who is hanging from the studio ceiling, upside down...) Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Get down from there!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: From where?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: From the ceiling!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (talking between clenched teeth) Zorak, you get down from that ceiling and play me to the desk!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No. (Space Ghost aims his powerband to shoot)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ahh, this isn't fun anymore... (comes back down, Way Outs start to play)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Baby. (aside) Why couldn't I be scraping him off my windshield? (aloud) Alrighty! My first guest chronicled the first, no, pfft - Alrighty! My first guest chronicled the first known battle for the night, please welcome Bill Carter!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Okay, let's go.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Welcome Citizen Bill, how are you?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Oh, very good, how are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And the name of your book is...

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: "The Late Shift."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Give us the name in its entirety!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) "The Late Shift, Letterman, Leno and the Network Battle for the Night". See, I've got it memorized.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I see. Bill, I'm part of the late night talk show war, why wasn't I included in your book?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: (his head changed to Gilligan, then morphs back to Bill) You hadn't gotten your show yet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sings a ditty)

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: But, you know, maybe when we get to the paperback you'll be a hit.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (evil laugh) Good one, Bill! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: That, that was a good one! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bill, in your book you reference eleven... (waits until Bill and Zorak stop laughing) I said, you reference eleven-thirty. What type of weapon is that, and why is it so desirable?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: It's, uh, it's a very, uh, profit-making weapon, it makes a lot of money for anyone who owns it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I see. (long pause) You know, I don't remember Letterman or Leno as super-heroes, but I do remember Conan!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, he was a, he was a very powerful super hero himself...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He had wit and muscle.

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: ... unfortunately that hasn't translated quite as well to television.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: His chest size does look diminished.

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hm.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, Bill, I could lift the Empire State Building if I wanted!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: That is a feat, now if you put that on television you're gonna get ratings.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I wish I had a dollar for every time people have told me that. When do you wish for a dollar?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: I wish I had a dollar for every time I've been asked 'why is late night important?'

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, if you've been asked that say twelve times, then you'd have uh...

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: I don't know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's see....that's one dollar at twelve times... about NINETY THREE DOLLARS!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Yeah...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's a lotta dough.

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that gives you a lot of power.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Speaking of power, Johnny Carson's here tonight... (quietly) You don't think he wants my show, do you?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: He, uh, I think he's enjoying his retirement.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, yeah, me too. Say Bill, how do you like my show so far?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I think probably Jay gives a better monologue.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's a monologue?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: It's uh...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (cutting in) It's uh, the part of the show where the host sets you free...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you sure, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (wearing a black wig) What I lie to you, sugar?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course you would. Hey Bill, look at Zorak. Have you ever seen evil so personified as you do in his skeletal shell?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: That's his strength.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I could break his stick-body in half if I wanted to. (aside, to camera) And I want to...

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: ... it looks, looks sort of bony.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Locusts have hollow bones.

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Well, there was a point in time when there was some question about him being on television because an executive said his face scared small children...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No kidding. Before you go Bill, do you have any words of wisdom to tell us?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: I'm not a small child.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There you have it! He's not a small child. Thanks for being with us, Bill!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Thanks, I hope that was what you wanted...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My next guest is recently retired from...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (wearing a red wig) Space Ghost, Bill is still here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak! What's that thing on your head!?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's my wig!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, take it off!

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: Where's the funny part come in?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Need a coin for the bus Bill?

transcript.speaker: Bill Carter
transcript.dialogue: I'm gonna be taking a subway. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: (Moltar is watching "CHiPs" in control room on monitor, while following is written across screen
GALAXY 5 125 W
transcript.dialogue: TRANSPONDER 17AUDIO 6:2/68FULLY 12:45:34SYNC AMPLITUDE15 IPSECRYPTED 294

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My next guest has recently retired from the Late Night Battle... please welcome Joe Franklin!

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Is this the rehearsal, or we taping?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Citizen Joe, we're thrilled to have you on!

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Pleasure!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Planet.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Gooey.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Deer Tick.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Who knows.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell us what's in your pocket.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: I've got my, uh, oxygen pen...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, whatever. So when were you born?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: I was born at a very early age.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You've written millions of books and you were television's first talk show host. How did it all begin?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: When I was born, something horrible happened; I lived.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Awwww!

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: And then what I did was decide to become a talk show host. I was 17, I figured I would try it for about 6 months, and, uh, that was 43 and a half years ago.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Forty-three years in the business, you must have talked to a lot of people.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Well, for the sake of accuracy, over three hundred thousand.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What advice can you give me?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: The, uh, main function is to get the plug out of the way first.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You wanna plug something, don't you Joe?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: (nodding) Yeah, I think so.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Go ahead.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: I'm uh, doing a lot of radio, I'm on WOR all night, I'm doing the "Memory Lane" show, I'm on a very popular news station called WBBR...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We have to do a commercial, Joe. (Way Outs start to play)

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: ... Bloomberg radio I do nostalgic news all day along and...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We have to do a commercial, Joe!

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: ... I'm their movie critic and drama critic, and uh, I've got a publicly...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We will be right back.
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: We now return to, hmmm, whatever.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: (still plugging) my new book's now in its third printing, because the first two printings were booked, and I am doing... (keeps talking in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty! Hey Zorak, is that a new wig?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (wearing a gold wig) What wig?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That wig!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (watching a "CHiPs" van crash)

transcript.speaker: Ken
transcript.dialogue: (on screen) It's, it's Ken, the satellite guy. I've got Johnny Carson standing by on Star Feed... fourteen.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (annoyed by interruption) Thanks. (switches back to "CHiPs"; a man is in an overturned van, surrounded by snakes, screaming "Help me, get me out please!")

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell us, Joe...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Did you have a band?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Well, I had a band once, it was a band of two people, a drummer...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (to Space Ghost) Baby.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: ... and a pianist. And the trouble was that the pianist kept running into the control room to always hear how the band sounded.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Indeed.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: You know, Barbra Streisand was my singer.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that sound like fun.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Joe, who was your favorite guest ever?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: I would say Bing Crosby.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wasn't he an android?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: I always thought of Bing being, you know, what you would say, mechanically reproduced. I always thought of Bing Crosby...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Joe, you're Mr. Talk Show, you started all of this... cough up some tips.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Number one, main ingredient as I've said before is sincerity...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmm hmmm.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: ... and once you learn to fake that... then you've got it made.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (dripping with fake sincerity) Thank you Joe, for what is without a doubt our best interview yet.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: Boy, you're a great host, you're a great interviewer, you really are a fantastic...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look Joe, we have to run... any final thoughts?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: It's nice to be important but it's more important to be nice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, I mean something that we can use.

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: On that promissory note... (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Joe Franklin, he's a, uh, what are you, Joe?

transcript.speaker: Joe Franklin
transcript.dialogue: TV Legend.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: TV Legend. Speaking of legends, it's my great honor to say, Heeeeeere's Johnny! (drum roll; a multitude of things flash by on the studio monitor, including a placard reading "The Wild Wild Planet")

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (watching another "ChiPs" scene, a woman running down a road, screaming for help) C'mon, c'mon, c'mon, c'mon! Get to the wreck!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clears throat; title screen from "Man from U.N.C.L.E" flashes by on the studio monitor) Heeeeeere's Johnny!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: C'mon wreck! Wreck! WRECK!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said, HEEEEEEEEERE'S JOHNNY! (a shot of someone in bunny slippers and several people in white helmets flash by on studio monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Where's the feed? (switches to Banana Splits sock puppet - "Bow, bow bow, bow bow bow bow bow bow!") No! (Switching more - The Dilly Girls sing, The sock puppet sings, Rosebud, Gone with the Wind, 2001, Forbidden Planet, no Johnny.) Where's the feed? Where's the feed?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Heeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeere's Johnny!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (switching furiously) Johnny? Johnny? (Last switch, Randy floats in space, Moltar is frustrated) Whatever. (sends Randy through to Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (staring at screen) Greetings Johnny! Boy, it's a gr... You have pincers!

transcript.speaker: Randy
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, how's Ed and Doc?

transcript.speaker: Randy
transcript.dialogue: Fine, fine, fine...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (doubtfully) Noooo kidding. (looks at Randy) You're not Johnny Carson, are you?

transcript.speaker: Randy
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really?

transcript.speaker: Randy
transcript.dialogue: Uh, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dee dee dee dee dee dee dee dee!
